hw1
Class Ticket

java.lang.Object
  hw1.Ticket

public class Ticket
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates information in a ticket which includes the balance of the ticket, the presence of a discount, whether or not a trip is in progress, and where the ticket was last rung up. It allows access to the location, balance, presence of a discount, and presence of a trip. With this ticket you can also charge money against the balance and start a trip.

Author:
Michael Lux Section 14 Professor Kautz

Constructor Detail

Ticket

public Ticket(int givenBalance,
              boolean discounted)
Constructs a new ticket using the value given as a balance and stores the presence of a discount. The ticket starts out without a trip in progress and with an invalid smart zone.

Parameters:
givenBalance - the total amount (in pennies) that is to be present on the card
discounted - whether or not there is a discount on the card. True if there is and false if there isn't.
Method Detail

beginTrip

public void beginTrip(int zone)
Starts the trip for the ticket and stores the given Smart Zone. Subsequent calls of the ticket will say it is in a trip.

Parameters:
zone - the smart zone the ticket was used at

getStartZone

public int getStartZone()
Returns the smart zone from which the ticket was originally used at for that ticket

Returns:
the smart zone the ticket was originally used at

isDiscounted

public boolean isDiscounted()
Tells is the current ticket is discounted or not. True if there is and false if there isn't.

Returns:
the presence of a discount, true if there is and false if there isn't.

getBalance

public int getBalance()
Returns how much money is left on a ticket (in pennies)

Returns:
the amount left on the card in pennies

charge

public boolean charge(int rideCost)
Reduces the balance on this ticket by the given amount, if possible. If the balance is less than the ride cost, this method returns false without modifying the ticket balance; otherwise reduces the balance by the given amount and returns true.

Parameters:
rideCost - the total cost of the ride
Returns:
True if the transaction was successful false if it wasn't.

isInTransit

public boolean isInTransit()
Tells whether or not the ticket has been swiped in successfully (True), or if it has been successfully swiped out (false). If the ticket has not been used it will return false.

Returns:
the swiped in our out status. True if swiped in successfully or false if swiped out successfully. Will return false if ticket has not been used
